documentation.text:
@title ExtendedAccessControl
 @dev This is a extension from openzeppelin AccessControl that allow to require determinated number of admin votes to assign or revoke roles
@dev set required number of votes to assign or revoke role*
@dev stores  approvals for specific address and role*
@dev stores address of administrators that voted to assign a role to a specific address*
@dev stores votes to revoke specific role for an addres*
@dev stores address of administrators that voted to revoke a role to a specific address*
@dev update votation to revoke role and if the number of votes are greater than the requiredvotes revoke role *
@dev update votation to assign a role to an address and if the votes are greater than required votes assign role*

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "You can vote only one time"

arguments.value: You can vote only one time

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "You can vote only one time"

documentation.text: @dev update votation to assign a role*

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "You can vote only one time"

arguments.value: You can vote only one time

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "You can vote only one time"

documentation.text: @dev update votation to revoke a role*
@dev reset votation for specific address and role*

 @dev This is a extension from openzeppelin AccessControl that allow to require determinated number of admin votes to assign or revoke roles
@dev set required number of votes to assign or revoke role*
@dev stores  approvals for specific address and role*
@dev stores address of administrators that voted to assign a role to a specific address*
@dev stores votes to revoke specific role for an addres*
@dev stores address of administrators that voted to revoke a role to a specific address*

@dev update votation to assign a role to an address and if the votes are greater than required votes assign role*

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "You can vote only one time"

documentation.text: @dev update votation to revoke a role*
@dev reset votation for specific address and role*

devdoc.details: This is a extension from openzeppelin AccessControl that allow to require determinated number of admin votes to assign or revoke roles

constructor.details: set required number of votes to assign or revoke role*

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: update votation to assign a role to an address and if the votes are greater than required votes assign role*

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `account`.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: update votation to revoke role and if the number of votes are greater than the requiredvotes revoke role *

_roleApprovalVotation.details: stores  approvals for specific address and role*

_roleRevokeVotation.details: stores votes to revoke specific role for an addres*

_rolesApprovalVotes.details: stores address of administrators that voted to assign a role to a specific address*

_rolesRevokeVotes.details: stores address of administrators that voted to revoke a role to a specific address*

devdoc.title: ExtendedAccessControl
